snippet: Shortly after Arkansas adopted the country’s most stringent abortion limits, North Dakota’s Legislature approved a bill blocking the procedure as early as six weeks into pregnancy.
abstract: North Dakota’s Legislature approves bill banning most abortions as early as six weeks into pregnancy; action comes shortly after Arkansas adopted country's most stringent abortion limits, banning procedure at 12 weeks of pregnancy; Gov Jack Dalrymple has not said whether he will sign bill into law.
lead_paragraph: Shortly after Arkansas adopted the country’s most stringent abortion limits, North Dakota’s Legislature approved a bill blocking the procedure as early as six weeks into pregnancy.

headline.seo: North Dakota Approves Bill to Ban Abortions as Early as 6 Weeks
headline.main: Bill in North Dakota Bans Abortion After Heartbeat Is Found
headline.print_headline: North Dakota Approves Stricter Ban On Abortions
